intro: Primula officinalis subf. firma, commonly known as the firm-flowered primrose, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 15–30 cm, with hairy stems and oval, dark green leaves. The plant produces clusters of showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, or purple, which bloom in early spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial shade to full sun. This sub-species is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used historically in traditional medicine.
